text: I personally have never seen this and I've been dealing with HubSpot auth for a while, The most common issue is usually the scopes don't match up
In this screenshot it appears that the app is already install on your account

hey <@U01QVR44MEY> sorry to bother you, but did this sound right to you? Figured I should @ you, since you seem to be the most active in this channel. :slightly_smiling_face: I’ve just been reading that documentation over and over and just wanted someone else to confirm the lacking ability of that endpoint.
Let me check over this in just a couple of minutes

Hi guys,
We are facing an issue randomly appearing in our HubSpot system that we have some contacts which accidentally have 1 more additional emails associated, assumably they are added by us calling a deprecated V1 endpoint of yours
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/batch_create_or_update>

This endpoint should create new contact as it stated in documentation
“If an email address is used, and there is not an existing record with that email address, then a new contact record will be created.”

But instead it seems to update a random existing contact making it original primary email A as additional email, setting the new email B provided as a new primary one.

We started to iteratively move away from the V1 endpoint and use V3, which helped us discover this issue.
Did anyone faced similar issue?
Of course, he can walk you through flow of how we solved this for him

Hello Team!
Our Client are trying to authenticate using OAuth 2.0 but getting following error :
” Couldn’t complete the connection
This install link is no longer valid. Please visit <https://ecosystem.HubSpot.com/marketplace/apps|HubSpot's App Marketplace to install this app. " >

Here is the information that passing while doing authentication :
Our authorization Like :  <https://app.HubSpot.com/oauth/authorize?client_id=${CLIENT_ID}&scope=contacts&state=${>
state.key
}&redirect_uri=XXXXXXXXX”

Also I am attaching request for access token for reference :
```{
method: 'POST',
url: `<https://api.hubapi.com/oauth/v1/token>`,
data: `grant_type=authorization_code&client_id=${CLIENT_ID}&client_secret=${CLIENT_SECRET}&redirect_uri=XXXXXXXXXX&code=${code}`,
headers: {
'Content-Type': 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded;charset=utf-8',
},
} ```
Yep this is correct, unfortunately you can't get the data from the reports currently
But there is some talk about allowing users to query datasets (which you can build reports from) so this would solve your issue
gotcha but that would be in the new reports API when it rolls out…i’m assuming
Yep, currently the reports api is just pretty under-powed in how you would think it would work
But you can get all the information for your above usecase using the search api or graphql though

Hi everyone, I am trying to query the API by a date range.  From what I understand dates are stored in UTC.

So If I want to query from Nov 1st to Nov 11th and I live in the Pacific Time Zone what dates would I send to the server?
